intro: Echium thellungii, commonly known as the Canary Island fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces long, slender flower stalks. Echium thellungii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
